title: Dodgers Defeat Blue Jays 5-4 in Game 7, Clinching World Series
snippets: Following the Toronto Blue Jays' heartbreaking Game 7 loss, some of the players are set to become free agents in the off-season, so what's next for the team.
The Toronto Blue Jays lost the World Series to the Los Angeles Dodgers in extra innings in Game 7. Many fans said they're shocked at the result, but hopeful for the future.
Vlad Jr., Blue Jays Disappoint MLB Fans in World Series Loss to Shohei Ohtani, Dodgers Bleacher Report
Max Scherzer Comments on His MLB Future After Blue Jays World Series Loss Sports Illustrated
Max Scherzer spoke to the media after the World Series to discuss how it felt to lose, if they can take any consolations away and what he will remember from it.

A fan favourite throughout his remarkable season, Ernie Clement probably developed an even closer bond with Toronto Blue Jays supporters after his post-game meeting with reporters on Saturday. A teary-eyed Clement looked much like many of the fans at Rogers Centre following the Blue Jays’ 5-4 Game 7 loss to the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series. “The only thing I can think of right now is spending this last night with all the boys,” an emotional Clement said. “I’m just going to miss them in the off-season. I couldn’t wait to come to the field every day and just hang with everybody. I’ve...

TORONTO — Toronto Blue Jays fans across the country are heartbroken after their hopes of seeing the team win its first World Series in 32 years were dashed by the Los Angeles Dodgers. The Dodgers beat the Blue Jays 5-4 in extra innings Saturday after a tense Game 7 in front of a sell-out crowd […]
Blue Jays' Game 7 loss in World Series leaves McDavid 'gutted' NHL.com
In the aftermath of Game 7, closer Jeff Hoffman was still wearing his Blue Jays cap — as well as that gutting loss. Sportsnet’s Kristina Rutherford has more from inside the locker room.

The Blue Jays won the American League East and then the American League. Then, on the verge of the third World Series championship, the final prize slipped through their fingers in the most heartbreaking of fashion.
titles: After World Series loss, what’s next for the Toronto Blue Jays?
‘Heartache’: Toronto Blue Jays fans feel weight of World Series loss
Vlad Jr., Blue Jays Disappoint MLB Fans in World Series Loss to Shohei Ohtani, Dodgers - Bleacher Report
Max Scherzer Comments on His MLB Future After Blue Jays World Series Loss - Sports Illustrated
‘Proud to be a Blue Jay’: Scherzer reflects on World Series loss
Blue Jays’ Ernie Clement very emotional after gut-wrenching World Series loss
Hope turns into heartbreak for Toronto Blue Jays fans after World Series loss
Blue Jays' Game 7 loss in World Series leaves McDavid 'gutted' - NHL.com
‘Cost everybody in here a World Series ring’: Hoffman, Blue Jays gutted after Game 7 loss
Blue Jays lose heartbreaker to Dodgers in Game 7 of World Series
summary: The Toronto Blue Jays lost the World Series to the Los Angeles Dodgers 5-4 in extra innings during Game 7, ending their hopes for their first championship in 32 years. The loss was particularly emotional for players and fans, with some players, including fan favorites and free agents-to-be, expressing their disappointment and reflecting on the season's journey. Despite the defeat, there's a sense of hope for the future among the team and its supporters.

title: 11 Hospitalized in London Train Stabbing; Man Arrested, Not Terrorism-Linked
snippets: Police said two people who were wounded remain in a life-threatening condition after the attack on Saturday. Passengers reported scenes of panic and chaos ,with many running through the carriages.
UK police says two British men arrested after train attack Reuters
UK train stabbings injure nine, police arrest two suspects Reuters
U.K. officials said they did not believe the attack on a train to London was connected to terrorism. One of the 11 people injured in the stabbing spree remains in critical condition, the police said.
UK police say train stabbings carried out by lone attacker, not terrorism Reuters

One person remains in a life-threatening condition after being attacked aboard a train near Cambridge, England. Police dismissed speculation of a terrorist attack and released one of two suspects taken into custody.
UK police say mass stabbing on train wasn’t terrorist incident, 2 Brits arrested Al Arabiya English
Man arrested on suspicion of attempted murder is British national born in the UK
British Transport Police said the "heroic" LNER staff member had tried to stop the attacker.

Police were questioning a 32-year-old British man Sunday on suspicion of attempted murder over a mass stabbing attack that spread fear and panic on a London-bound train and left 11 people hospitalized.

summary: In a stabbing attack on a London-bound train near Cambridge, England, 11 people were hospitalized, with one in critical condition. UK police have arrested a 32-year-old British man on suspicion of attempted murder, releasing the second suspect taken into custody. Authorities have clarified the incident, which caused widespread panic, was not related to terrorism. A rail worker was praised for their heroic efforts during the event.

title: Avalanche in South Tyrol Kills Five German Climbers
snippets: Five German mountaineers died after being hit by an avalanche in South Tyrol, in northern Italy, rescuers said on Sunday.

Bodies of missing man and 17-year-old daughter who had fallen 200 metres found on Sunday morning in South Tyrol Five German climbers, including a 17-year-old girl, have died after being swept away by an avalanche in the Italian Alps, rescuers have said. Italian media said three groups of climbers –
Five German climbers killed in Italian Alps avalanche Reuters
The bodies of two more German mountaineers have been discovered following the avalanche in South Tyrol. Meanwhile, Berlin police arrested a man suspected of planning an attack. DW has more.
The climbers were in two groups in northern Italy on Saturday night when an avalanche struck. Two people survived.
titles: 5 German mountaineers die in northern Italy after being hit by avalanche
Five German climbers die in Italian Alps after being swept away by avalanche
Five German climbers killed in Italian Alps avalanche - Reuters
Germany news: Italy avalanche kills climbers, bodies found
5 German Climbers Are Killed by Avalanche in Italian Alps
summary: Five German climbers, including a 17-year-old girl, died in an avalanche in South Tyrol, northern Italy. The victims were part of two groups mountaineering when the avalanche occurred on Saturday night. Two individuals survived the incident. The bodies were recovered on Sunday.

title: Cam Little Sets NFL Record with 68-Yard Field Goal
snippets: Jacksonville Jaguars kicker Cam Little hit an NFL-record 68-yard field goal as time expired in the first half against the Las Vegas Raiders at Allegiant Stadium.
Watch as Cam Little drills a 68-yard field goal to close out the first half against the Raiders, setting a new NFL record for the longest kick in history.
Cam Little of the Jacksonville Jaguars broke an NFL record by kicking a 68-yard field goal at the end of the first half against the Las Vegas Raiders on Sunday.
Little's boot adds two yards to the league's previous longest kick
Cam Little made NFL history by making a 68-yard field goal in the game between Jacksonville Jaguars and Las Vegas Raiders.
titles: Jags' Little sets NFL record with 68-yard FG
Jaguars’ Little drills new NFL record 68-yard field goal

'HE DID IT!' | Cam Little kicks the longest field goal in NFL history!
summary: Cam Little of the Jacksonville Jaguars set a new NFL record by kicking a 68-yard field goal against the Las Vegas Raiders, surpassing the previous record by two yards. This historic kick occurred as time expired in the first half at Allegiant Stadium.

Yoshinobu Yamamoto was named the World Series Most Valuable Player (MVP) after his significant contributions in three games, including Game 7 heroics. The series included a benches-clearing brawl in Game 7 and celebrations from the Dodgers, marking their victory as a historic achievement in baseball.

title: Philippines, Canada Sign Defence Pact Amid China Tensions
snippets: Philippines, Canada sign pact on troops to deepen defence ties Reuters
China has frequently accused the Philippines of acting as a 'troublemaker' and 'saboteur of regional stability'.
There was no immediate comment from China, which has accused the Philippines of being a “troublemaker” and a “saboteur of regional stability."
Philippines Inks Military Pact With Canada in Bid to Deter China Bloomberg.com

OTTAWA — Defence Minister David McGuinty has signed a defence co-operation agreement with the Philippines, on the final day of a visit meant to strengthen defence relations. The agreement will allow the Canadian and Philippine armed forces to work closer together by participating in operations and e
titles: Philippines, Canada sign pact on troops to deepen defence ties - Reuters

summary: The Philippines and Canada have signed a defence cooperation agreement aimed at deepening their military ties. This pact, signed by Canadian Defence Minister David McGuinty in Ottawa, will enable both countries' armed forces to collaborate more closely, including participating in joint operations. The move comes amidst ongoing accusations from China, labeling the Philippines a "troublemaker" and "saboteur of regional stability." China has yet to comment on this new agreement.

title: Trump Says Xi Assures No China Action on Taiwan During His Term
snippets: Trump says China's Xi has assured him that he won't take action on Taiwan during Republican's term AP News
US president claims Beijing won't act on Taiwan while Trump is in the White House, 'because they know the consequences'.

“He has openly said, and his people have openly said at meetings, ‘We would never do anything while President Trump is president,’ because they know the consequences.”

Trump says China’s Xi has assured him that he won’t take action on Taiwan during Republican’s term
summary: US President Trump has stated that China's President Xi Jinping assured him China will not take action on Taiwan during his term. Trump emphasized that Xi and his officials are aware of the 'consequences' if China invades Taiwan, suggesting a deterrence based on potential repercussions.

title: India Wins First Women's Cricket World Cup, Defeats South Africa
snippets: Shafali Verma scores 87 and Deepti Sharma takes five wickets as India make history, beating South Africa by 52 runs for their first World Cup title in Navi Mumbai.
India's women post 298-7 in Navi Mumbai before bowling South Africa out for 246 to claim the 2025 Cricket World Cup.

Final: India, 298-7, beat South Africa, 246, by 52 runs Shafali and Deepti shine for hosts in Navi Mumbai At last, 50 years on from their debut on the world stage, India’s dream came true: a first World Cup triumph, in front of a deafening full house in Navi Mumbai, as they defeated South Africa by
Highlights from the Women's Cricket World Cup final where India held off South Africa to be crowned champions.
India have won the Women’s Cricket World Cup for the first time after a thrilling 52-run victory over South Africa in a rain-delayed final in Navi Mumbai.
titles: India beat South Africa for historic World Cup win
India’s women beat South Africa to claim first Cricket World Cup
India rejoice in first Women’s World Cup triumph as South Africa fall short
Highlights: India beat South Africa to win Women's Cricket World Cup
India make history after epic World Cup final win over South Africa
summary: India won their first Women's Cricket World Cup by defeating South Africa by 52 runs in Navi Mumbai. Shafali Verma scored 87 runs, and Deepti Sharma took five wickets, leading India to score 298-7. South Africa was bowled out for 246. This historic victory comes 50 years after India's debut on the world stage, marking a significant achievement in front of a packed stadium.

snippets: Auburn fires coach Hugh Freeze following 12th loss in his last 15 SEC games AP News
Auburn has fired football coach Hugh Freeze, who had a 15-19 record and a 6-16 mark in SEC games in his two-plus seasons. D.J. Durkin will be the interim coach.
Freeze amassed just a 15-19 record in nearly three seasons leading the Auburn program

summary: Auburn University has terminated the contract of football coach Hugh Freeze after a 4-5 start to the 2025 season, culminating in his record of 15-19 overall and 6-16 in SEC games over his tenure. D.J. Durkin has been appointed as the interim coach. This decision follows Freeze's struggle, losing 12 of his last 15 SEC games.

title: Louvre Heist Perpetrated by Local Criminals, Not Organized Crime: Prosecutor
snippets: Louvre heist work of petty criminals, not organised crime, prosecutor says Reuters
The Paris prosecutor says four suspects arrested so far are "clearly local people", not organised crime professionals.
Security at the Louvre museum in Paris was outmaneuvered not by a team of professional thieves, but a group of local amateurs, authorities have said.

Laure Beccuau said ‘upper echelons of organised crime’ unlikely to be involved as one perpetrator remains at large The brazen daytime heist at the Louvre was carried out by petty criminals rather than professionals from the world of organised crime, the Paris prosecutor has said, describing two of t

Louvre jewel heist by petty criminals, not organised professionals, says Paris prosecutor
summary: The Paris prosecutor announced that the Louvre museum heist was executed by local petty criminals, not by professionals linked to organized crime. Four suspects have been arrested, while one remains at large. Authorities emphasized that the individuals involved are "clearly local people," dismissing the involvement of the "upper echelons of organized crime."

title: Trump Threatens Military Action Against Nigeria Over Christian Violence
snippets: Trump threatens US military action in Nigeria over treatment of Christians Reuters
Trump also warned of aid cuts over alleged attacks on Christians, though an adviser to Nigeria’s president dismissed the remarks as a negotiating tactic.
The move is an escalation in the president’s campaign against the West African country’s government over allegedly failing to protect Christians.
Accusing Nigeria of not doing enough to protect Christians from violence, President Trump said he had ordered the Pentagon to prepare for action.
Trump Warns Nigeria It May Face US Military Action Over Attacks Bloomberg.com

summary: President Donald Trump has threatened military action against Nigeria, accusing its government of failing to prevent violence against Christians. He stated that he has directed the Pentagon to plan for potential intervention. This marks an escalation in his criticism of Nigeria's handling of religious persecution. The Nigerian government has denied these accusations, asserting that it does not condone violence against Christians.

title: Texans QB C.J. Stroud Out with Concussion, Misses Broncos Game

Stroud exited the game in the second quarter
Houston Texans quarterback C.J. Stroud sustained a concussion after hitting his head hard on the ground at the end of a run in the second quarter of Sunday’s 18-15 loss to Denver.

title: OPEC+ Plans Minor Oil Output Hike in December, Pauses Increases for Q1 2026
snippets: OPEC+ agrees to small December oil output hike, and Q1 pause Reuters
OPEC+ pauses oil output hikes beyond December amid glut fears Reuters
OPEC+ to Pause Output Hikes After Small December Increase Bloomberg.com
OPEC+ to Agree Small Output Hike for December, Delegates Say Bloomberg.com
The eight nations of OPEC+ announced Sunday they will pause oil-production hikes in the first quarter of 2026, following a modest increase in December, as part of an effort to avoid a glut of crude.
OPEC+ will pause output increases during the first quarter — after making another modest hike next month — as the group balances its push for market share against signs of an emerging surplus.
titles: OPEC+ agrees to small December oil output hike, and Q1 pause - Reuters
OPEC+ pauses oil output hikes beyond December amid glut fears - Reuters
OPEC+ to Pause Output Hikes After Small December Increase - Bloomberg.com

OPEC+ to pause output hikes in first quarter to ease fears of glut, after one more boost in December
OPEC+ to Pause Output Hikes Next Year as Market Set for Glut
summary: OPEC+ has decided to implement a minor oil output increase in December 2025, followed by a pause in production hikes for the first quarter of 2026. This decision aims to balance market share ambitions with concerns over a potential surplus in crude oil.

title: Kenyan Runners Sweep NYC Marathon; Kipruto, Renowned Female Athlete Win
snippets: Kipruto, an Olympic bronze medalist, narrowly beat fellow Kenyan Alexander Mutiso in the Pro Men's race, as both men finished with a time of 2:08:09.
Kenya sweep men's and women's podiums at NYC Marathon Reuters

summary: Olympic bronze medalist Kipruto won the NYC Marathon Pro Men's race, finishing alongside fellow Kenyan Alexander Mutiso with a time of 2:08:09. In the women's race, a renowned Kenyan marathoner secured her second victory since 2023, leading to a Kenyan sweep of both men's and women's podiums at the event.

title: Mississippi Homeowner Kills Escaped Monkey, Cites Children's Safety
snippets: Jessica Bond Ferguson said her 16-year-old told her about animal in the yard and she shot it to ‘protect her children’ One of the monkeys that escaped after a truck overturned on a Mississippi roadway on 28 October was shot and killed early Sunday by a homeowner who said she feared for the safety of
One of the monkeys that escaped last week after a truck overturned on a Mississippi roadway was shot and killed early Sunday by a homeowner who says she feared for the safety of her children.
“I shot at it and it just stood there, and I shot again, and he backed up and that's when he fell.”
titles: Mississippi woman fatally shoots monkey escaped from overturned truck
Mississippi mom feared for children's safety, fatally shot escaped monkey
Fearing for her children’s safety, Mississippi woman shoots and kills escaped research monkey
summary: A homeowner in Mississippi shot and killed one of the monkeys that escaped following a truck accident on October 28, citing fear for her children's safety. The incident occurred early Sunday when Jessica Bond Ferguson encountered the animal in her yard.

title: Explosion at Mexico Store Kills 23, Injures 12 in Sonora
snippets: A fire and explosion at a convenience store in northwestern Mexico killed at least 23 people, including children, and injured 12 others, state authorities said.
Fire and explosion at store in northwestern Mexico leave at least 23 dead and a dozen injured AP News
The fire ripped through a store in Hermosillo, a city in Sonora State. Officials said minors were among the victims.

summary: A fire followed by an explosion at a convenience store in Hermosillo, Sonora State, northwestern Mexico, resulted in at least 23 fatalities, including children, and injured 12 others, according to state authorities.

summary: Hamas has returned three more bodies of hostages to Israel for identification, as part of an ongoing ceasefire agreement. These remains were discovered in a tunnel in southern Gaza. This follows the kidnapping of hostages by Hamas on October 7, 2023, with eight bodies still to be returned.

title: US Airports Face Delays Amid Shutdown, Air Traffic Staff Shortages
snippets: Half of major US airports are experiencing staff shortages and delays.
The poor are suffering the most as the political stalemate continues.

Flight delays continued at U.S. airports Sunday amid air traffic controller shortages as the government shutdown entered its second month, with Newark airport in New Jersey experiencing delays of two to three hours. New York City’s Emergency Management office said on X that Newark delays often rippl

summary: Half of major US airports, including Newark in New Jersey, are facing delays due to air traffic controller shortages as the government shutdown extends into its second month. These delays, ranging from two to three hours, are exacerbating the impact on the poor amid ongoing political stalemate.

title: NBA Fines 76ers' Embiid $50K for Lewd Gesture vs Celtics
snippets: Joel Embiid is hit with a fine after his WWE taunt caught negative attention with the league
76ers' Joel Embiid Fined $50K by NBA for 'Lewd Gesture' in Loss to Celtics Bleacher Report

Joel Embiid is losing a solid chunk of change. The NBA has fined the Philadelphia 76ers star $50,000 for making a “lewd gesture” on the court, the league announced on Sunday. The incident occurred midway through the first quarter of Philly’s loss to the Boston Celtics on Friday, after Embiid made an and-one. It’s not the first time Embiid’s been fined for on-court antics. He was hit for $75,000 on Dec. 27, 2024 for an “obscene gesture” against coincidentally — or maybe not so — the Celtics. Embiid finished Friday’s matchup with 20 points and six rebounds in just 25 minutes. The former MVP has...

summary: Joel Embiid, star of the Philadelphia 76ers, was fined $50,000 by the NBA for making a "lewd gesture" during a game against the Boston Celtics. The incident, which occurred in the first quarter following an and-one, marks another instance of Embiid being fined for on-court behavior; he previously faced a $75,000 fine for an "obscene gesture" in a game also against the Celtics. Embiid scored 20 points and had six rebounds in the recent game.

Israel says it received the remains of 3 hostages from Gaza as fragile ceasefire holds
summary: Israel confirmed the receipt of three hostages' remains from Gaza for forensic examination, maintaining a fragile ceasefire now a month old. The remains were discovered in a southern Gaza tunnel, as stated by Hamas.

title: Mexico City's Dia de Muertos Parade Draws 1.5M; Michoacán Mayor Assassinated
snippets: This year, Mexico City's grand Dia de Muertos parade has drawn about 1.5 million people. The event was inspired in part by a James Bond movie.

Carlos Alberto Manzo Rodríguez, who was under police protection, was shot dead in front of dozens of people A mayor in Mexico’s western state of Michoacán was shot dead in a plaza in front of dozens of people who had gathered for Day of the Dead festivities, authorities have said. The mayor of the U
Michoacán state Mayor Carlos Manzo, who called for a take-no-prisoners approach to Mexico's drug cartels, is slain while marking the Day of the Dead holiday.
titles: Mexico celebrates Day of the Dead festival
Mexican mayor killed during Day of the Dead celebrations
Mexican mayor who waged war on cartels is slain while celebrating Day of the Dead
summary: Mexico City's Dia de Muertos parade attracted approximately 1.5 million attendees, inspired by a James Bond film. Meanwhile, Carlos Alberto Manzo Rodríguez, the mayor of a town in Michoacán known for his tough stance on drug cartels, was assassinated in front of spectators during Day of the Dead celebrations.

title: Van Dijk Hits Back at Rooney's "Lazy" Criticism of Liverpool's Form
snippets: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk says Wayne Rooney blaming a lack of leadership for the Anfield side's recent poor form is "lazy criticism".

Anfield captain calls some takes ‘absolutely ridiculous’ Liverpool ended run of four defeats with win over Villa Virgil van Dijk has called Wayne Rooney’s criticism of him and Mohamed Salah this season “lazy” and has hit out at “ridiculous takes” during Liverpool’s recent bad run. Rooney, talking on
titles: Van Dijk rejects Rooney's 'lazy criticism'
Virgil van Dijk hits back at Wayne Rooney’s ‘lazy’ criticism of Liverpool
summary: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk responded to Wayne Rooney's comments attributing the team's poor performance to a lack of leadership, calling it "lazy criticism." Van Dijk also criticized other negative takes on Liverpool's form as "absolutely ridiculous." This comes as Liverpool ended a streak of four defeats with a victory over Aston Villa.

title: Fossil Fuel Lobby Impacts US Classrooms Amid Environmental Research Advances
snippets: As the long arm of the fossil fuel lobby enters the classroom, some US science teachers are finding their job requires more than simply imparting knowledge and wisdom.
What the Whales Are Saying Inside Climate News
Can Cows and Solar Power Coexist? We’re About to Find Out Inside Climate News
titles: What US school kids are learning about climate
What the Whales Are Saying - Inside Climate News
Can Cows and Solar Power Coexist? We’re About to Find Out - Inside Climate News
summary: US science teachers are facing challenges beyond teaching, as the influence of the fossil fuel lobby extends into classrooms. Meanwhile, research explores communication among whales and the potential for cows and solar power to coexist, indicating a growing focus on understanding and integrating environmental considerations in various fields.
